intro: Tristaniopsis ninndoensis, commonly known as the Nindong tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly in regions of Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It grows as a small to medium-sized tree, typically reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Due to habitat loss, Tristaniopsis ninndoensis is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts to protect its natural environment.
